block.p: Leone Marion Rendon and Kenneth Scott Litt were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Anthony Gambuzza, a minister of the Federation of Christian Ministries, performed the nondenominational ceremony at the New York Academy of Sciences.

Mrs. Litt, 33, was until last week the legal assistant in the office of the general counsel at the American Museum of Natural History in Manhattan. Next month she is to begin her first year at New York Law School. She graduated from Barnard College, and is a daughter of Marion B. Rendon of Great Neck, N.Y., and Jaime Rendon of Bogota, Colombia. Her mother retired from Chase Manhattan Bank in Manhattan, for which she was a second vice president in the real estate finance division. The bride's father is a farmer and rancher in Ibague, Colombia.

Mr. Litt, 34, is an editor of books on intellectual property issues at the Matthew Bender Publishing Company in Manhattan. He graduated from Adelphi University and received a law degree from St. John's University. He is a son of Barbara E. Litt and Morton S. Litt of Forest Hills, Queens. His father is a divisional merchandise manager in the Bloomingdale's store at the Roosevelt Field Mall in Garden City, N.Y.
